name: Hotel Sant Anna Roma

reviews.title: Hotel S. Anna, a little hotel that cares
Oh So Wonderful
reviews.text: This hotel and their staff were amazing. Especially Mario who not only obtained Papal Audience passes for my wife and I and even an unexpected guest but also on his off day went to another part of Rome and obtained a Papal Blessing document (which we had previously requested from a convent in a remote part of town). We were not only pleased with the accommodations but pleasantly surprised how much this hotel cares for its guests. Next time in Rome definitely Hotel Santa Anna. Again my sincere appreciation to Mario for making our stay so wonderful.

reviews.title: Excellent and friendly
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel S. Anna on our first trip to Italy. Very conveniently located near the Vatican. The staff was courteous, the hotel very clean and lovely. And there was a lovely little restaurant a few doors away where we enjoyed dining outside in the evening and the waiter was terrific, and the food was out of this world. We would definitely recommend this hotel. PS it was VERY hot in June and the air conditioned hotel was a welcomed relief.
Excellent hotel, friendly staff, wonderful location 3 blocks from vatican and great air conditioning. From here you can walk to Pantheon, Spanish steps, Trevi, forum colleseum and vatican in 1 day.
reviews.title: A Perfect Location for a Charming Hotel

reviews.text: Based on the review in the Rick Steve's guidebook we stayed at the Hotel S. Anna for a week in May and were very disappointed.
reviews.title: Rick Steve's Disappointment
Great hotel
reviews.text: First the good, yes, the hotel is in a great location right next to the Vatican on quiet little street (Borgo Pio). There are various restaurants, small markets, bakeries, etc so you pretty much get everything you want with almost no effort. In comparison to some of the other hotel prices in the area it seams reasonable and they did honor the Rick Steves discount. Front desk staff was friendly.

The bad, I dont have that great a sense of smell but as soon as I opened the door I thought we were sleeping in an abandoned cheese cellar. Room was pretty funky and seemed like it recieved it's last renovation in 1982 (green & brown). Probably the biggest complaint was the noise from the other rooms. We were awakened every morning (6:30+) from slamming doors and thin walls. (I actually tried to find a room at Capo D Africa and the Mercure and others but everything was booked)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel...my new home in Rome

reviews.text: Also, below average buffet, cranky breakfast staff, no bar, TV got one channel, when I asked about internet access they pointed to the phone jack, noisy neighbors next door,
reviews.title: A nice little hotel in a small side street away from the buzzle of the city
Loved it!
reviews.text: If you want minimal accomodations near the Vatican than this is for you. If you need a refuge from the busy Rome streets I would go elsewhere.

We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Sant'anna on the Borgo Pio a stones throw from St Peter's. I have to say that the rooms were clean and comfortable and larger than expected. They also have a nice, simple breakfast buffet included in the price. The rooms in front of the hotel had some street noise. The Borgo Pio isn't really a through street so there isn't constant traffic, but there are restaurants and shops that open early and close late. So you are a light sleeper, get a room in the back.
reviews.title: Nice little Boutique hotel near St Peter's
Great location and service!
reviews.text: The front desk was more than helpful. Mario, who is on during the day is more than adequate with his english.

There are 6 or 7 Trattorias just outsde the door, one of which ROMANELLA is to be avoided due to its mediocre food and its shameful practice of bringing you the bill and then advising you that the tip is not included in the price and adding on a non-existant 10 Euro "Tax" to the bill. I'm sure that they feel that with so many options you will only eat there once, so get every nickel they can squeeze out of you.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: But, aside from ROMANELLA's deceitful practice, which by the way was not recommeded by the Sant'anna staff, it was a delightful stay.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
Loved it !!
reviews.text: The location was perfect for us, as we were in town for only 3 days. We appreciated being able to walk over to the Vatican area early in the morning and easily back to to hotel to cool off in the heat of the day. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful with all kinds of travel information and dining suggestions. There were 3 couples in our group and we were all very pleased with our rooms and the hotel in general. It's a really nice little oasis amid the crowds and busy streets of Rome.

reviews.title: Excellent small hotel
reviews.text: My family just returned from Italy, and spent 4 nights at the Hotel Santanna. We all loved our time there. The location was perfect, a quiet pedestrian street, two blocks from the Vatican. The staff was extremely helpful with whatever we needed, including arranging for a taxi to meet us at the airport. The rooms were cheerful and had ample space. The rooms were exceptionally clean. The rate included a lovely breakfast of fruit, cereal and pastries, and cappucino's on request. Our three teenagers like it the best of all our Italian hotels. I thought it was a great bargin and would definitly stay there again!

description: In the monumental setting of the Rome of the Popes, in a 16th century building in the shadow of St. Peter’s Basilica, the Hotel Sant’Anna offers gracious hospitality in the best hotel tradition. The salon and the enchanting courtyard offer pleasant setting for meetings and relaxation. Hotel Sant’Anna, a superior three star Rome hotel, will certainly offer to its guests a very nice and comfortable atmosphere.The Hotel Sant’Anna has 3 floors served by an elevator and rooms for disabled people on ground-floor. An American buffet breakfast is served In the charming breakfast room, where decorative murals evoke view of the city. The hotel has also a pretty courtyard and some rooms with terrace. A garage is available close to the hotel from 23 Euro per day. Possibility to book tours of Rome at the hotel’s desk.
